title: As an IT User I want to be able to add permissions to an existing Role
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=roles___permissions
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=add_permissions_to_a_role

Acceptance Criteria: 
* While the IT utility is in edit mode, there is an Add Permissions button contained within each Role. 
* Clicking the "Add Permissions" button will launch a modal in which the user can select a permission to add to the relevant role.
* On the modal there is a searchable dropdown where the user can add any non-role permission.
* The user can add multiple rows by clicking the "Add Row" button. 
* Once more than one row exists, each row has a trash can icon available, with clicking the trash can icon removing the relevant row. 
* If only one row is present, there is no trash can icon. 
* Once a group is selected in the modal for each added row, the "Add" button becomes available. 
* Clicking "Add" will add the selected permissions to the relevant Role. 
* Clicking "Cancel" will close the modal with no permissions being added to any role. 
* Clicking "Save" on the IT Utility will commit the changes, and display a blue successful save notification.

title: As a user I want to be able to run each of the batches from the End of Year Service process screen
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=yearly_end_of_service_batch_process

Use this wireframe as reference for when a batch is running
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=batch_running

Acceptance Criteria: 
* There will be a "Run" button for each of the batches on the screen as well as a dropdown where the user can select which mode to run each batch in (Report, Test and Update). 
* Clicking "Run" for any of the batches will run the relevant batch in the selected mode.
* While any one of these batches is in progress (not others in the system), the other "Run" buttons will disable and the batch currently running will display an "Abort" button in red instead. 
* The batch that is currently running will display a progress bar to indicate to the user how far along the current batch is (just like if this were run for the batch from its individual batch screen). 
* Clicking "Abort" for the batch being run will abort the currently running batch and re-enable all of the run buttons.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to delete an account from ebis
custom_steps:
Wire:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=user_accounts_-_boc
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=delete_user

Acceptance Criteria:
* When a BOC user with user accounts edit permissions is editing or viewing an individual user's account, there is a "Delete" button.
* Clicking the button will open a modal asking the user to confirm that they wish to delete the account, and allowing them to also specify if they want to request Account removal from all systems. 
* If the user does not indicate that they wish submit a ticket to deactivate the account and they click "Confirm", then the system will remove the relevant user id from all ebis related LDAPs, including ebis-user. 
* The system will display a blue success notification indicating that the user was deleted from ebis, and the user will be returned to the main User Accounts screen.
* If the user indicates that they wish to delete the account and also submit a ticket to deactivate the account and they click "Confirm", then the system will remove the relevant user id from all ebis related LDAPs, including ebis-user AND generate an email to bocservicedesk@mlb.com with a request to deactivate the selected account. The email should be sent from the logged in user's email address, with the subject "Disable User Account" and in the body of the email the following should appear: 
 - "Please disable all accounts for *username*."
* A blue success message displays when the email has been successfully sent.

title: As a user I only want to see those International Player Reports that I have permission to see
custom_steps:
*Nothing has changed here - just need to make sure this still works now that we can create new International Prospect reports*

Business Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89347726

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Users without permissions to view, edit or approve international player reports do not see these in the Scouting History at all. 
* Users without permissions to view, edit or approve international player reports should receive a permission error if they attempt to navigate to these directly via URL.
* Users without permissions to view, edit or approve international player reports should not be able to search for these items. 
* All users that have permission to view/edit/approve these reports should see these reports in the Scouting History of players and advanced search IF the record status is Approved. 
* Users that are NOT identified as Scouts that have permission to view/edit/approve these reports should see these reports returned in Advanced Search if they have a status other than Approved ONLY IF the user specifically applies the status filter. If they do apply the status filter, then they should be able to see any report in the system. 
* Users that ARE identified as Scouts that have permission to view/edit these reports should see these reports returned in Advanced if they have a status other than Approved ONLY IF the creating user of the report matches the current user. 
  - They do not need to apply additional filters to see non-approved statuses. 
  - Even if they DO apply additional status filters, they cannot see non-approved reports entered by other users. 
* Users that ARE identified as Scouts that have permission to view/edit these reports should see these reports in a player's Scouting History if they have a status other than Approved ONLY IF the creating user of the report matches the current user.

title: As a scouting user I want to resubmit a new international prospect report for review
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria:
* Scouts see any workout reports created by them on their Scout Clipboard when they are in a Rejected status.
* Opening a Rejected report from the Clipboard opens the report in edit mode with a "Save" "Cancel" and "Submit" button available.
* The scout should be able to edit the report and save changes without a required field or formatting check.
* Clicking "Submit" from a rejected report should save any edits made, run a business rules, required field and format check and complete the submission, just as though the report were in a Preliminary status. 
* A blue notification is thrown "Successfully Submitted"
* The report should have its status updated to Submitted, and appear on the Admin Clipboard and Scout Clipboard as Submitted.

title: As a Club user I want to send an email containing Sign Up instructions to a new user
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=user_accounts_-_club
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=request_new_user

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a Club user is viewing the new User Accounts utility, there is a hyperlink that reads "Request New User".
* Clicking "Request New User" will prompt the user to enter the First Name, Last Name and email address of the new user being requested. 
* When the user clicks "Send", ebis will generate an email to the email address entered with a Subject line of "EBIS Access Request" and the following content:

Dear *First Name* *Last Name*-

You are receiving this email because your Club recently requested a new EBIS account for you. You'll need to complete the following before you are able to access EBIS (https://ebis.mlb.com).

Complete the EBIS User Registration Form HERE as soon as possible. MLB will not be able to grant your request for access until you finish this step. Once you complete the EBIS User Registration Form you'll receive two emails: the first is confirmation that we received your request, the second is that it was approved.

AFTER you receive the second email confirmation you'll need to click on the link in that email to create your password.

Finally, after your account password has been created, you'll need to set up MLB's Okta Multifactor authentication app on your mobile device. Instructions on how to do that are available HERE.

If you have any questions please contact your Club's Baseball Operations department.

Thank you,

The EBIS Team


* The "HERE" for ebis user registration will be this link: https://clubhouse.mlb.com/UserRegistrationForm/?GROUP=EBIS2.0

* The "HERE" for the Okta instructions will be this link: https://mlb.app.box.com/s/lzvyo3a2ma4s05nga9g8ujl4s5z88u55

You are receiving this email because the Commissioner's Office recently requested a new EBIS account for you. You'll need to complete the following before you are able to access EBIS (https://ebis.mlb.com).

Complete the EBIS User Registration Form HERE as soon as possible. MLB will not be able to grant your request for access until you finish this step. Once you complete the EBIS User Registration Form you'll receive two emails: the first is confirmation that we received your request, the second is that it was approved.

AFTER you receive the second email confirmation you'll need to click on the link in that email to create your password.

Finally, after your account password has been created, you'll need to set up MLB's Okta Multifactor authentication app on your mobile device. Instructions on how to do that are available HERE.

If you have any questions please contact the Baseball Operations department.

Thank you,

The EBIS Team


* The "HERE" for ebis user registration will be this link: https://clubhouse.mlb.com/UserRegistrationForm/?GROUP=EBIS2.0

* The "HERE" for the Okta instructions will be this link: https://mlb.app.box.com/s/lzvyo3a2ma4s05nga9g8ujl4s5z88u55

title: As a user I want to be able to reverse and re-approve a transaction
custom_steps: Acceptance Criteria: * When a transaction is in a Reversed state, there is a "Re-Approve" button for BOC users that have edit permissions for the transaction. * Clicking "Re-Approve" will move the transaction state back to approved, first checking all required field and format and on submit/approve rules, just as if the transaction was being approved for the first time. * The Approved By/Date information with the original approver informationand capture a new set of fields that are like "Reapproved" that only show to BOC where relevant* If the Reversal and/or re-Approve happen on a MJ Transaction for which the Transaction Bulletin was already sent - do not include a reversal line item OR a new approval line item for the transaction. *The primary usecase for this is changing transaction dates or other fields on the transaction itself that might alter something about the player and/or require Pro-Roster to be run on the player. Ideally we would also figure out a way to leverage this for inserting transactions, since that also comes up frequently.*

title: As a User, I want to update existing users when adding a permission to an existing role
custom_steps: Business Value:When a role is update with new permissions, there is no easy way to update already existing users to add the new permission.  A new button in the Add Permissions flow will help accomplish that.AC: - When editing an existing role on the Roles & Permission screen, there will be an 'Add Permissions' button - Clicking the button will launch the Add Permissions modal - In addition to the 'Add' and 'Cancel' buttons, there will now be a "Add and Apply to Users' button - Clicking this button will add the selected permissions to the role AND update all users who currently have the roleRelated to: https://jira.boc.mlb.com:8443/browse/EBISII-16207

title: As a User, I want to indicate an Injury Discrepancy on a Waiver Request - INC0114933
custom_steps: Wire:https://4why3k.axshare.com/#p=injury_discrepancyAC: - When requesting OR or TRD Waivers for a player, there will be a "Injury Discrepancy" checkbox, as depicted in the wire - When this checkbox is selected, "Please make BOC aware prior to submission" will appear, as depicted - Request Bulletins will include the following text for players who have this box checked:  -- "Club asserts the player is able to play at accustomed level. Player asserts that he is injured and unable to play at his accustomed level." - This text will appear on both the PDF version of the Bulletin as well as in the email versionUI:I think the responsive classes on the request blocks will need to be adjusted for this addition.  The following seems to work pretty well, but open to suggestions if you feel something works better. Type(col-md-3 col-sm-6 col-xs-12)Latest Transaction(col-md-4 col-sm-6 col-xs-12)Injured(col-md-2 col-sm-6 col-xs-12)Injury Discrepancy(col-md-3 col-sm-6 col-xs-12)Comments(col-md-12 col-sm-12 col-xs-12)

title: As a user I only want to see those International Player Reports that I have permission to see
custom_steps: *Nothing has changed here - just need to make sure this still works now that we can create new International Prospect reports*Business Rules:https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89347726Acceptance Criteria: * Users without permissions to view, edit or approve international player reports do not see these in the Scouting History at all. * Users without permissions to view, edit or approve international player reports should receive a permission error if they attempt to navigate to these directly via URL.* Users without permissions to view, edit or approve international player reports should not be able to search for these items. * All users that have permission to view/edit/approve these reports should see these reports in the Scouting History of players and advanced search IF the record status is Approved. * Users that are NOT identified as Scouts that have permission to view/edit/approve these reports should see these reports returned in Advanced Search if they have a status other than Approved ONLY IF the user specifically applies the status filter. If they do apply the status filter, then they should be able to see any report in the system. * Users that ARE identified as Scouts that have permission to view/edit these reports should see these reports returned in Advanced if they have a status other than Approved ONLY IF the creating user of the report matches the current user.   - They do not need to apply additional filters to see non-approved statuses.   - Even if they DO apply additional status filters, they cannot see non-approved reports entered by other users. * Users that ARE identified as Scouts that have permission to view/edit these reports should see these reports in a player's Scouting History if they have a status other than Approved ONLY IF the creating user of the report matches the current user.

title: As a user I want to submit a MJ/MN Outright's Notice of Disposition for e-signature
custom_steps:
Wireframes:
https://82lvmf.axshare.com/#p=submit_a_single_c_for_e-sig

Acceptance Criteria:
* There is an "E-Sign" button on MJ/MN Outright transactions that are in a submitted or higher state for Club users with permission to edit the transaction.
* Clicking "E-Sign" will open a menu for the user to select "Notice of Disposition".
* Selecting "Notice of Disposition" from the e-sign menu will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to continue.
* If the user clicks Cancel then they are returned to the transaction and nothing is done.
* If the user clicks Submit for E-Signature then the system will generate the pdf and send the pdf for e-signature following our standard e-sig workflow outlined below. 
* Once the Notice of Disposition is successfully submitted for e-signature, it appears in the Player E-Signature widget when filtering for "MJ Notices of Disposition".

E-signature workflow: 
* Once the Submit for E-sign button is clicked on the 'Are you sure' modal, show another modal with a loading indicator and messaging that PDF is being generated as shown in the wireframe
* Clicking outside of the loading modal will NOT close the modal.
* There is a countdown on the message that indicates an estimate of how much time is remaining until the document is ready for e-signature.
* If the document has not been generated at the end of 30 seconds, try again 2 more times and show the second message from the wireframe for attempt 2 and 3.
* If the document cannot be generated for any reason, display the failure message depicted in the wireframe.
* Once the document has been successfully sent for e-signature, the success message from the wireframe is displayed, stating that the document is ready for e-signature. 
* The user will have the option to close the modal using the x or the Close button. 
* When viewing the transaction, clicking the "E-Sign" button will now re-open this modal.

title: As a user I want to get a MJ/MN Outright's Notice of Disposition e-signed by the player
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria:
* Once completing one of the below flows, the notice of disposition drops from the Player Signature widget and appears in the "Club Signature" widget when filtering for MJ Notices of Disposition.
* The "Date Signed" field on the NOD is populated with the date that the player signed the NOD. 

From the transaction: 
* Clicking the "e-sign" button on the transaction opens the successful e-sign modal. 
* There is an e-sign icon on the Frozen column to the left of player
* Club can click on the icon to bring up the PDF of the NOD for player to e-sign. After this, the club hands the device over to the player
* Player is guided by the Adobe echo sign interface. The player will need to be guided to typing their name and drawing their signature. 
* Adobe should insert the signature on the PDF at the space above the line which is reserved for the Player's signature
* Once the player finishes the Adobe process, the PDF is closed and player hands back device to club.
* When the user returns to ebis and re-opens the E-sign status message, the Player line is checked off with the date that the player e-signed the form. 

From the Player Signature widget:
* There is a column on the Player E-signature widget with an e-sign icon on the Frozen column to the left of player
* Club can click on the icon to bring up the PDF of the NOD for player to e-sign. After this, the club hands the device over to the player
* Player is guided by the Adobe echo sign interface. The player will need to be guided to typing their name and drawing their signature. 
* Adobe should insert the signature on the PDF at the space above the line which is reserved for the Player's signature
* Once the player finishes the Adobe process, the PDF is closed and player hands back device to club

title: As a user I want to stamp the Club's signature on the MJ/MN Outright's Notice of Disposition
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria:
* Once completing the below flow, the e-signed notice of disposition is attached to the MJ/MN Outright with the attachment label "Notice of Disposition".

From the Club Signature widget: 
- Selecting one or more checkboxes should enable the STAMP SIGNATURE button
- When no checkboxes are selected, button should be disabled
- Hitting Stamp Signature should insert the club's pre-stored signature into the PDF for all of the selected rows. 
- System should use the stored signature of the signatory for each row. In other words, if user selects rows for different signatories, system should stamp the appropriate stored signature for that row.
- The club's date signed field on the PDF should be automatically populated with the date of the stamping
- If the stamping was successfully complete, the forms fall off the Club e-signature widget and a notification is shown "x document(s) were successfully E-Signed"

title: As a club, I want any updates to a MJ/MN Outright that is currently being e-signed to invalidate my E-signatures
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
- Once a MJ/MN Outright's  Notice of Disposition form is currently in the e-signature state, anytime a user attempts to save changes to the release other than updating the status, it should prompt a soft error:
**Body:** You are attempting to update this form while E-signatures are in the process of being collected.
**Hint:** If you continue, it will clear all E-signature progress and you will have to start again.
**Buttons:** [Ignore and Continue][Cancel]
- The error only appears on hitting the Save changes button (or Submit/Approve). It does not prevent a user from putting the form in edit mode
- If user hits Cancel, do not save the users changes.
- If the user hits Ignore and Continue, then save the user's changes but withdraw the PDF from E-sig state.
- If the PDF is withdrawn, the user is allowed to submit for e-sig again or upload a PDF.
- Withdrawn PDFs should no longer show in the Player or Club e-signature widgets

Users can also cancel e-signature by doing the following: 
- Clicking the "E-Sign" button on a transaction that has been submitted for e-sig opens a modal that contains a "Cancel E-Signature" button available on the modal.
* Clicking "Cancel E-Signature" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to cancel the e-signature process (see comments). 
* If they do not confirm, then the user is returned to the form and the e-signature process is not cancelled.
* If they do confirm, then the form is withdrawn from e-signature and no longer appears in any of the e-signature widgets. The user is now able to restart the e-signature process by clicking "E-sign" on the form again if they wish.

title: As a user, I want to be stopped if Authorized Signatory is not pre-populated before e-signing
custom_steps:
**Acceptance Criteria**
* A hard error is triggered on the MJ/MN Outright that is being submitted for e-sig if
  -- The transaction does not have the Authorized Signatory field populated. "None" is not an acceptable value to count as being populated.
  -- Or if the Authorized signatory chosen does not have a stored signature on the Auth Sig widget

The error message is
Error: Please select an Authorized signatory who has a stored signature to continue with E-signature
Hint: You can add and update signatories on the Authorized Signatory widget

title: As a user I only want to see MJ NODs in the Player Signature widget if I have permission to e-sign MJ NODs
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria:
* When a user is viewing the Player E-Signature widget, either "MJ Notices of Disposition" is not available in the Type filter, or no results are returned when this option is selected, unless the user has permission to esign Major League Notices of Disposition (we are not going to do this on a transaction level). 
* When a user is viewing the Clu E-Signature widget, either "MJ Notices of Disposition" is not available in the Type filter, or no results are returned when this option is selected, unless the user has permission to esign Major League Notices of Disposition (we are not going to do this on a transaction level).
* This needs to be a new permission that we create specifically for this purpose. 
* This new LDAP should be added to the following roles: 
 - ebis-mj-trans-club-admin-role
 - ebis-mj-trans-boc-admin-role

title: As a user, I want to be stopped if Authorized Signatory is not pre-populated before e-signing
custom_steps:
**Acceptance Criteria**
* A hard error is triggered on the transfer that is being submitted for e-sig if
  -- The transfer does not have the Authorized Signatory field populated. "None" is not an acceptable value to count as being populated.
  -- Or if the Authorized signatory chosen does not have a stored signature on the Auth Sig widget

The error message is
Error: Please select an Authorized signatory who has a stored signature to continue with E-signature
Hint: You can add and update signatories on the Authorized Signatory widget

title: As a user, I want to be stopped if Authorized Signatory is not pre-populated before e-signing
custom_steps:
**Acceptance Criteria**
* A hard error is triggered on the release that is being submitted for e-sig if
  -- The transaction does not have the Authorized Signatory field populated. "None" is not an acceptable value to count as being populated.
  -- Or if the Authorized signatory chosen does not have a stored signature on the Auth Sig widget

The error message is
Error: Please select an Authorized signatory who has a stored signature to continue with E-signature
Hint: You can add and update signatories on the Authorized Signatory widget

title: As a user I want to be warned if I try to submit a NOD for e-sig and it has already been e-signed
custom_steps:
Messages #3:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Transactions+E-Signature+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When clicking "E-Sign" from a Release that has already had the e-signature workflow completed for the Notice of Disposition, display a warning. See Messages #3. 
* If the user ignores and continues, the e-signature process is re-kicked off and the end result will be two e-signed forms attached to the transaction. (or however many times the user has done this)

title: As a player, I want the date I signed the PDF to be auto-populated
custom_steps:
**Acceptance Criteria**
- The Player's date signed field on the PDF must be auto-populated by Adobe with the date that the player signed.
- The player should not need to enter the date himself nor should he able to edit the date.

title: As club, I want to see list of transfer NODs that need club signature
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
http://82lvmf.axshare.com/#p=club_e-signature

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Selecting the "MN Notices of Disposition" filter in the widget will display any transfer Notices of Disposition that are awaiting a Club Signatory's signature. (Note that we need to rename the existing NOD option)
* All of the columns are populated with the relevant and correct information.
* The default population for this widget should be all forms that are 
  -- currently waiting in E-signature state, 
  -- have a club signature required,
  -- the club signatory has a stored sig on Auth sig widget
  -- have not yet gotten the club e-signature
* The widget is default sorted on Signatory's name alphabetically
* Signed by player should the date the player e-signed.

title: As a player, I want to e-sign my transfer NOD in person from the Player Signature widget
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
http://82lvmf.axshare.com/#p=player_e-signature__club_

Adobe e-sign (sample mock up)
http://82lvmf.axshare.com/#p=start_1


Acceptance Criteria:
* There is a column on the Player E-signature widget with an e-sign icon on the Frozen column to the left of player
* Club can click on the icon to bring up the PDF of the transfer's NOD for player to e-sign. After this, the club hands the device over to the player
* Player is guided by the Adobe echo sign interface. The player will need to be guided to typing their name and drawing their signature. 
* Adobe should insert the signature on the PDF at the space above the line which is reserved for the Player's signature
* Once the player finishes the Adobe process, the PDF is closed and player hands back device to club
* The form now drops off the Player E-signature widget. 
* This workflow must work on on all screen sizes

title: As a club I want to bring up a list of my transfer NODs that are waiting for an E-Signature

Wire:
http://82lvmf.axshare.com/#p=player_e-signature__club_

* Selecting "MN Notices of Disposition" in the Player E-Signature widget will display a list of the forms that are currently waiting in E-Signature state that require a player signature. (Note that we need to rename the existing NOD option)
* The widget should be appropriately populated with the Player's Name, ID, Form Type (Transfer) and the date the NOD was submitted for E-Sig. 
* The widget is default sorted on Player's name alphabetically.
* Widget should be secondary sorted by player id on initial load

title: As a user I want the player to e-sign the transfer's NOD in person from the transfer
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://82lvmf.axshare.com/#p=submit_a_single_c_for_e-sig

Acceptance Criteria:
* When the Notice of Disposition has been successfully sent for e-signature per story #160775339, the success message from the wireframe is displayed, stating that the document is ready for e-signature. 
* The user will have the option to close the modal using the x or the Close button. 
* When viewing the transfer, clicking the "E-Sign" button will now re-open this modal. 
* There is an e-sign icon on the Frozen column to the left of player
* Club can click on the icon to bring up the PDF of the transfer's NOD for player to e-sign. After this, the club hands the device over to the player
* Player is guided by the Adobe echo sign interface. The player will need to be guided to typing their name and drawing their signature. 
* Adobe should insert the signature on the PDF at the space above the line which is reserved for the Player's signature
* Once the player finishes the Adobe process, the PDF is closed and player hands back device to club.
* When the user returns to ebis and re-opens the E-sign status message, the Player line is checked off with the date that the player e-signed the form. 
* This workflow must work on on all screen sizes

title: As a club, I want to see the e-signed PDF attached to my Transfer
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria:
- E-Signed PDFs should now appear in the attached file section on the MN Transfer transaction with a label of Notice of Disposition.
- Similar to uploaded PDFs, the e-signed PDFs should open up on clicking the file, following the same behavior as the uploaded PDFs
- User should be able to see the E-signatures of the player and club as well as the Date signed field for both on the PDF

title: As a user I want to be able to cancel the e-signature process for a transfer's NOD
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria:
- Clicking the "E-Sign" button on a transfer that has been submitted for e-signature should open the e-signature status message per story #160775429.
* There should be a "Cancel E-Signature" button available on the modal.
* Clicking "Cancel E-Signature" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to cancel the e-signature process (see comments). 
* If they do not confirm, then the user is returned to the form and the e-signature process is not cancelled.
* If they do confirm, then the form is withdrawn from e-signature and no longer appears in any of the e-signature widgets. The user is now able to restart the e-signature process by clicking "E-sign" on the form again if they wish.

title: As a club, I want to stamp multiple transfer NODs with the Authorized Signatory's signature
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://82lvmf.axshare.com/#p=player_e-signature__club_
https://82lvmf.axshare.com/#p=stamp_signature

Acceptance Criteria:
- Selecting one or more checkboxes should enable the STAMP SIGNATURE button
- When no checkboxes are selected, button should be disabled
- Hitting Stamp Signature should insert the club's pre-stored signature into the PDF for all of the selected rows. 
- System should use the stored signature of the signatory for each row. In other words, if user selects rows for different signatories, system should stamp the appropriate stored signature for that row.
- The club's date signed field on the PDF should be automatically populated with the date of the stamping
- If the stamping was successfully complete, the forms fall off the Club e-signature widget and a notification is shown "x document(s) were successfully E-Signed"

title: As a user I want to be warned if I try to submit a NOD for e-sig and it has already been e-signed
custom_steps:

title: As a club, I want any updates to a Transfer that is currently being e-signed to invalidate my E-signatures
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
- Once a transfer's Notice of Disposition form is currently in the e-signature state, anytime a user attempts to save changes 
to the Transfer To, Assignment Date or Authorized Signatory field, it should prompt a soft error:
**Body:** You are attempting to update this form while E-signatures are in the process of being collected.
**Hint:** If you continue, it will clear all E-signature progress and you will have to start again.
**Buttons:** [Ignore and Continue][Cancel]
- The error only appears on hitting the Save changes button (or Submit/Approve). It does not prevent a user from putting the form in edit mode
- If user hits Cancel, do not save the users changes.
- If the user hits Ignore and Continue, then save the user's changes but withdraw the PDF from E-sig state.
- If the PDF is withdrawn, the user is allowed to submit for e-sig again or upload a PDF.
- Withdrawn PDFs should no longer show in the Player or Club e-signature widgets

title: As a user I want an Offseason Assignment to be auto-created with the submission of an Addendum D
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria:
* Updating an Addendum D to the "Pending Approval" state will automatically create an Offseason Assignment transaction for the player. 
* If the player is a MN player, then a MN Offseason Assignment is created.
* If the player is a MJ player, then a MJ Offseason Assignment is created.
* The "League" on the Offseason Assignment is set to Arizona Fall League.
* The "Club" on the Offseason Assignment is set to the Club selected on the Addendum D. 
* The assignment date of the Offseason Assignment is equal to the Signing Date of the Addendum D. 
* The year of the Offseason Assignment is equal to the year selected in the Addendum D.
* Updating an Addendum D to the "Approved" state directly from preliminary will also automatically create an Offseason Assignment transaction for the player per the above criteria.

title: As a user I want to submit a release's Notice of Disposition for e-signature
custom_steps:
Wireframes:
https://82lvmf.axshare.com/#p=submit_a_single_c_for_e-sig

Acceptance Criteria:
* There is an "E-Sign" button on MN Releases that are in a submitted or higher state for Club users with permission to edit the transaction.
* Clicking "E-Sign" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to continue.
* If the user clicks Cancel then they are returned to the transaction and nothing is done.
* If the user clicks Submit for E-Signature then the system will generate the pdf and send the pdf for e-signature following our standard e-sig workflow outlined below. 
* Once the Notice of Disposition is successfully submitted for e-signature, it appears in the Player E-Signature widget when filtering for "MN Notices of Disposition".

E-signature workflow: 
* Once the Submit for E-sign button is clicked on the 'Are you sure' modal, show another modal with a loading indicator and messaging that PDF is being generated as shown in the wireframe
* Clicking outside of the loading modal will NOT close the modal.
* There is a countdown on the message that indicates an estimate of how much time is remaining until the document is ready for e-signature.
* If the document has not been generated at the end of 30 seconds, try again 2 more times and show the second message from the wireframe for attempt 2 and 3.
* If the document cannot be generated for any reason, display the failure message depicted in the wireframe.
* Once the document has been successfully sent for e-signature, the success message from the wireframe is displayed, stating that the document is ready for e-signature. 
* The user will have the option to close the modal using the x or the Close button. 
* When viewing the transaction, clicking the "E-Sign" button will now re-open this modal.

 - Transaction updates canceling e-signature
 - User cancellation of e-signature

title: As a Club User I want to see a Drug Test Requests widget
custom_steps: Wireframe:https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=drug_test_requests_-_clubData Discovery: https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Drug+Test+Request+Widget+-+Club+-+Data+DiscoveryAcceptance Criteria: - On the Club's International Dashboard there is a new "Drug Test Requests" tab.- On this tab there is the new Club Drug Test Requests widget.- The widget should follow the provided data discovery and wireframe.- The widget should only show the viewing Org's drug test requests. *Status mapping will be handled in a follow up story*

title: As a Club User I want to create a new blank Drug Test Request
custom_steps: Wireframe:https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=new_drug_test_requestData Discovery: https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Drug+Test+Request+Form+-+Data+DiscoveryAcceptance Criteria: - Clicking "Create New" on the Club's Drug Test Request widget would launch a new, blank Drug Test Request form per the provided wireframe. - Initially, the user would only see the Add Player section, and would be required to complete the required fields to click "Add Player"- Once a player has been successfully added to the form, the "Submit to BOC" button is enabled, and the "Add Player" button is greyed out. - If the user subsequently removes the added player by clicking the trash can icon, then the Add Player button becomes available again, with the Submit to BOC being greyed out once again. - The form should follow the provided data discovery and wireframe, including the disabling of fields once the player is added to the form.

title: As a BOC User I want to see a Drug Test Requests widget
custom_steps: Wireframe:https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=drug_test_requests_-_bocData Discovery: https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Drug+Test+Request+Widget+-+BOC+-+Data+DiscoveryAcceptance Criteria: - On the BOC's International Dashboard there is a new "Drug Test Requests" tab.- On this tab there is the new BOC Drug Test Requests widget.- The widget should follow the provided data discovery and wireframe.- Header filter will be covered in another story.

title: As a BOC Reg Analyst I want to see a Drug Test Requests widget
custom_steps: Wireframe:https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=drug_test_requests_-_analystData Discovery: https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Drug+Test+Request+Widget+-+Reg+Analyst+-+Data+DiscoveryAcceptance Criteria: - On the BOC's International Dashboard there is a new "Drug Test Requests" tab.- On this tab there is the new Reg Analyst Drug Test Requests widget.- The widget should follow the provided data discovery and wireframe. *Another story will cover the permissions to hide/show this widget and the other BOC widget, but they will share a tab*

title: As a Club User I want to create a new Drug Test Request for a player
custom_steps: Wireframe:https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=new_drug_test_requestData Discovery: https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Drug+Test+Request+Form+-+Data+DiscoveryAcceptance Criteria: - The Create New Icon on International Amateur player profiles is updated to have the new option of "Drug Test Request".- Selecting this item from the create new menu will launch a new Drug Test Request form for the selected player, with their information already prepopulated (including their ebisid). - The user should be able to submit the form to the BOC after completing the required information. - If the user chooses to 'trash' the added player, it would work just as though they had created this from scratch from the widget.

title: As a BOC Reg Analyst I want my Drug Test Request widget to only contain Requests Assigned to me
custom_steps: Wireframe:https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=drug_test_requests_-_analystData Discovery: https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Drug+Test+Request+Widget+-+Reg+Analyst+-+Data+DiscoveryAcceptance Criteria: - When a Registration Analyst is viewing the Reg Analyst's drug test request widget, the only requests that they are able to see are those that have their username in the "Registration Analyst" field.

title: As a BOC User I want to assign a Drug Test Request to a Registration Analyst
custom_steps: Wireframe:https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=drug_test_requests_-_bocData Discovery: https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Drug+Test+Request+Widget+-+BOC+-+Data+DiscoveryAcceptance Criteria:  - Clicking the checkbox on a Drug Request's row will activate the "Assign To" button in the footer of the widget - Clicking the button will launch a popover where the user can choose a Registration Analyst - A new stand alone permission will be created that can be added to individual ebis accounts - Only users with this permission will appear as possible Registration Analysts - Clicking the apply button within the popover will assign the request to specified analyst - The assigned requests will now appear on the appropriate analysts request widgets

title: As a Club User I want to submit a Drug Test Request for a player to the BOC
custom_steps: Wireframe:https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=new_drug_test_requestData Discovery: https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Drug+Test+Request+Form+-+Data+DiscoveryAcceptance Criteria: - When a Player has been added to the Drug Test Request form, the Submit to BOC button is enabled.- Clicking the button will run a required field and format check per the provided data discovery.- Once the required rules checks have passed, the form's status is updated to "Submitted" (for the Club) and "Pending Review" (for the BOC). - The Submitted form should show on the Club's Drug Test Request widget as Submitted.- The Submitted form should show on the BOC's Drug Test Request widget as Pending Review.

title: As a Club User I want clicking Add Player on a new Drug Test Request to check if the player already exists in the system
custom_steps: Wireframe:https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=new_drug_test_requestBusiness Rules:https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Amateur+-+Profile+VisibilityAcceptance Criteria: - When a user clicks "Add Player" on a Drug Test Request Form, the system should check to see if there is already a player profile entered for the information entered that the user has permission to see.- This should re-use the existing logic that is checked on the Create New for an International Amateur profile for Club users. - If a match is found, display the match(es) per the wireframe.- The user should have the ability to pick any of the existing profiles OR to add the newly entered information as a "new" player by selecting the appropriate entry via radio button and clicking "Add Player" - The appropriate player's information will be added to the form, and the user will have the opportunity to complete the form as usual. - Clicking Cancel will close the matching message and return the user to the form with no player added.

title: As a Club User, I want to view Social Media Consent Status on the Add C widget
custom_steps: Wire:https://f2j41d.axshare.com/#p=enter_social_media_consentAC: - There will be a new column added the Club version of the Addendum C widget - The column will be titled "SM Consent" as depicted in the provided wire - Possible Values for this column include:  -- None  -- Signed  -- Refused - This column should be tied to and display the same values as the corresponding field on the Player's Profile

title: Social Media Consent Report - Report
custom_steps: Report Details:https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Social+Media+Consent+Report+-+Report+DetailPopulation, Grouping, Sorting:https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=138941835Prompts:https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Social+Media+Consent+Report+-+Prompts

title: As a User, I want Social Media Consent Status changes tracked
custom_steps: Anytime the field is changed, either on the player profile, Add C widget, or by a transaction, we should track the following in an audit table: - Date / Time - Username - Triggering Action

title: As a user I want players with the Social Media Release checkbox information to be sent to FAMA
custom_steps: Feed Requirements: https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Feed+Requirements+-+FAMAExample:https://mlb.app.box.com/s/8akpelmd90r6gpco8oiygzjg38n62h40Acceptance Criteria: * An API is set up that sends the information required as specified for players that have the Social Media Release checkbox checked to FAMA. This will be similar to the Highmark batch. * EBIS information as well as any social media information available from Baseball data should be compiled and sent. * Presumably, we will also need a way to "remove" players from consideration in FAMA's system when they have the checkbox unchecked on their profile. * JoAnn and Jose have worked on delivering a one time dump to FAMA in the past so are best to reach out to with technical questions.* ??Whatever solution is arrived at - we need to ensure that it is either not run in lower environments, or that if it is run in a lower environment that it is NOT actually sent to FAMA. We would only want production data to reach them. ??* This will be build as a batch and will available through the Interfaces batch screen* The batch will send on player at a time to the FAMA API Interface* The batch will be run quarterly and include any players with Social Media Consent flagged as Yes* The batch will also be able to run on demand* There will be a JSON output available to confirm what data was actually sent to FAMA* There will be a "Send to FAMA" parameter, similar to the Highmark batch

title: As a Club User, I want to edit Social Media Consent Status on the Add C widget
custom_steps: Wire:https://f2j41d.axshare.com/#p=enter_social_media_consentAC: - Clicking the checkbox on a player's row will activate the "SM Consent" button in the footer of the widget - Clicking the button will launch a popover where the user can choose a status - Possible Values for this column include:  -- None  -- Signed  -- Refused - Clicking apply will set the player(s) SM Consent status the value specified by the user - Clicking the pencil icon on a player's row will make the row editable, including the "SM Consent" button - The "SM Consent" column will become a dropdown containing the following values:  -- None  -- Signed  -- Refused - Clicking the Save button will commit the changes and return the select row to view mode - Clicking the Cancel Changes button will discard any changes and return the select row to view mode - Any changes made to SM Consent on this widget will also be reflected on the player's profile - Any changes made to the corresponding field on a player profile should be reflected here

title: As a User, I want to Social Media Release checkbox on player profiles to be a dropdown
custom_steps: Acceptance Criteria: - The Social Media Release checkbox on player profiles should be converted to a dropdown - The values in the dropdown should be:  -- None  -- Signed  -- Refused - The dropdown should default to 'None'  - The dropdown is only editable by the BOC and the player's Org. - The dropdown is only editable for non 40-man players that are currently on an Org.  - Any action that would have caused the checkbox to be un-checked (covered in previous stories), should reset the dropdown to 'None'

* Reversing the transaction will re-set the flag if it was unchecked as a result of the transaction being approved.

title: As a User, I want to create a Transfer to 60-day IL (Minor) transaction
custom_steps: Wireframe:https://w6h8fs.axshare.com/#p=transfer_player_to_60-day_dl_1Rules:https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/16.+Transfer+to+60-Day+DLAcceptance Criteria:* There will be a "Create New" button on the Player History widget for all players.* There will be a "Create New" button on the Rosters widgets for all players.* "Transactions" is an option in the top-level dropdown.* "Injured List" should be an option under Minor Transactions.* "Transfer to 60-day IL (Minor)" should be an option in the fourth level dropdown.* Selecting "Transfer to 60-day IL (Minor)" from the Create New will load a new Preliminary transaction in edit mode. * Transaction should follow existing wireframe, but "Injured List" or "IL" should be substituted in for "Disabled List" or "DL."*All existing Rules and Updates from previous DL transaction should continue to work for this transaction.*Existing "Transfer to 60-day DL" should be removed from the menu*Existing "Transfer to 60-day DL" can still be loaded from users player history

title: As a scouting user I want to save as preliminary an International Prospect report for a player
custom_steps:
Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Prospect+or+Signable+Report+-+Data+Discovery

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a user is creating a new International Prospect report, there is a "Save" button as well as a "Cancel" button. 
* Clicking Cancel will ask the user to confirm that they wish to lose their changes. If they confirm, then the creation process is canceled, the profile discarded and the user returned to their point of entry.
* Clicking "Save" will save the report as "Preliminary" and a blue successful save notification will be thrown.
* No required field or formatting checks are run when saving a report in preliminary.

title: As a scouting user I want to see an error if the value entered in any OFP category does not have a value of 0 or 2-8 on an International Prospect report
custom_steps:
Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Player+Report+Rules

Messages:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

Acceptance Criteria:
* When a present or future grade field loses focus (user clicks out of the field or tabs out), the system checks that the value entered in the field is either 0, or a value between 2 and 8 (inclusive). 
* If not, display an error. See Messages #42.

title: As a scouting user I want to see an error if the present value in any OFP category is not less than or equal to the Future value on an International Prospect report
custom_steps:
Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Player+Report+Rules

Messages:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

Acceptance Criteria:
* When clicking "Submit" or "Approve", the system checks that the values entered in the Future grade fields are greater than or equal to the values entered in the Present grade fields. 
* If not, display an error. See Messages #41.

title: As a scouting user I want to see an error if the OFP Adjusted entered is not within 3 points of the OFP Basic on an International Prospect report
custom_steps:
Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Player+Report+Rules

Messages:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

Acceptance Criteria:
* When clicking "Submit" or "Approve", the system checks that the value entered in the OFP Adjusted field is within three points of the calculated OFP Basic. If not, and no comments are entered in the OFP Adjusted comments field, then display an error. See Messages #40.

*Example: if the OFP Basic is 50, the user can enter 47-53 without needing to enter comments, but if they enter a value outside of that range they need to provide comments*

title: As a scouting user I want to see an error if the entered OFP is not between 20 and 80
custom_steps:
Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Player+Report+Rules

Messages:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

Acceptance Criteria:
* When clicking "Submit" or "Approve", the system checks that the OFP Adjusted and Basic entered is a value between 20 and 80 (inclusive). 
* If not, display an error. See Messages #45.

title: As a scouting user I want to see an error if maximum velocity entered is not equal to or greater than minimum velocity on an International Prospect report
custom_steps:
Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Player+Report+Rules

Messages:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

Acceptance Criteria:
* When clicking "Submit" or "Approve", the system checks that the values entered in the Maximum Velocity fields are greater than or equal to the values entered in the Minimum velocity fields. 
* If not, display an error. See Messages #43.

title: As a scouting user I want the system to calculate a player's OFP and Group on an International Prospect Report
custom_steps:
Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Scouting+Calculations

Acceptance Criteria:
* The system calculates the OFP Basic and the Group number displayed on the International Prospect report on the fly (as the user enters grades) per the provided calculations. 
* The calculation is different depending on if the report is for a position player or a pitcher.

title: As a scouting user I want to create a new International Prospect report for a player
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://s8xnnx.axshare.com/#p=international_workout_report
https://s8xnnx.axshare.com/#p=prospect_report

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Prospect+or+Signable+Report+-+Data+Discovery

Acceptance Criteria: 
*Note that the report differs slightly from historical reports AND the wireframe is slightly out of date - use the data discovery*
* On the "Create New" screen, the "Type" dropdown contains "International Prospect Report" if the user has permission to create scouting reports.
* Selecting "international Prospect Report" displays per the provided wireframe.
* The user should be able to use the player field to pick a player to create the report for.
* The population of players available here should be all players that the user has permission to see in QuickSearch. 
* Selecting a player should enable the "Next" button.
* Clicking "Next" should take the user to a new International Workout report, per the provided data discovery and wireframe. 
* Changing the Position on the report should appropriately update the report to display the appropriate fields.

title: As a scouting user I want to Submit a new International Prospect Report for review
custom_steps:
Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Prospect+or+Signable+Report+-+Data+Discovery

Acceptance Criteria:
* As a scouting user, opening a preliminary player report in view mode, they will have an Edit, Submit and Close button.
* Clicking Close will close the profile.
* When the report is in Edit Mode, they will have a Save, Submit and Cancel button. 
* Clicking "Save" will save any edits made to the report. No required field and formatting checks should be run given that the report is in a Preliminary state. The report's status will not update.
* Clicking "Cancel" will ask the user to confirm that they wish to lose any changes. If the user confirms, the report's status will remain preliminary and the report will reload in view mode.
* Clicking "Submit" will run a required field and formatting check per the data discovery. 
* Once the report has passed the required field and formatting checks, if the report was in edit mode, it is reloaded in view mode.
* The report's status will update to "Submitted", and the status will be reflected on the creating scout's Clipboard. 
* The player report will appear for review on the scouting Admin's Clipboard.

title: As a scout admin I want to approve a new International Prospect report for a player
custom_steps:
Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Prospect+or+Signable+Report+-+Data+Discovery

Acceptance Criteria:
* When a user with permission to approve scouting reports is viewing an International Prospect Report that is in a Preliminary or Submitted status in Edit Mode should have Save, Approve, and Cancel buttons available.
* Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to lose their changes. If they confirm, the report is reloaded in view mode and no changes are saved.
* Clicking "Approve" will save any edits made to the report. All required field and formatting checks should be run. Once the field checks pass, the form should be reloaded in View Mode, and the report's status should be updated to "Approved" and a blue notification should be thrown.
* The required field checks will differ based on the Position entered on the report (not necessarily the same as the player's position on their profile). 
* The report should appear in the player's Scouting History widget.

title: As a scout admin I want to reject a new International Prospect report for a player
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria:
* Scouting Admins should see any International Prospect report with a Submitted status on their Admin Clipboard. 
* Opening the submitted report from the Clipboard should open the item in Edit Mode.
* Clicking "Reject" will save any edits made to the report. No required field or format checks are run. 
* A blue notification will be thrown "Successfully Rejected"
* The report's status should be updated to "Rejected". 
* The report entry should be removed from the Admin Clipboard.
* The Scout's Clipboard entry should be updated to "Rejected".

title: As a user I want to be able to quickly download all of the attachments on a form
custom_preconds: GIVEN a Club user logs in with view or edit permissions
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing MJC, UEC or any transactions with attached files section
custom_expected:
THEN The "Attached Files" section in View mode displays per the provided wireframe.
AND The user has the ability to quickly select All using the top level checkbox.
AND The user should still have the ability to download a single file by clicking on the file name.
AND Selecting more than one file will enable the download icon.
AND Clicking the download icon will zip the files and download the zipped file to the user's computer.

title: As a user I want to be able to email the attachments on a form
custom_preconds: GIVEN a Club user logs in with view or edit permissions
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing MJC, UEC or any transactions with attached files section
custom_expected:
THEN There is no longer an envelope icon available on the global Attached Files section in view mode.
AND The "Attached Files" section in View mode displays per the provided wireframe.
AND The user has the ability to quickly select All using the top level checkbox.
AND Selecting one or more file will enable the email icon.
AND Clicking the email icon will launch a new email window for the user using their default email. 
AND If more than 1 file was selected:
  - zip the files
  - include all the labels in the subject
  - use the first and last name as the zip filename
OR If only 1 file was selected: 
 - just attach the single file to the email
 - include the Last, First of the player the form is for followed by the attachment's label

Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=bulk_download_attachments
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=email_an_attachment
